document.docTitle: Nedinoschiza khuathalinhae Dzuong & Long & Mai & Hoa & Oanh & Nghiep 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of the subfamily Braconinae (Hymenoptera: Braconidae) from Vietnam

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 35. Habitus of
Nedinoschiza khuathalinhae Long
,
sp. nov.
, holotype, female (lateral).

subSubSection.paragraph: Description . Holotype , female, length of body 6.7 mm , fore wing 6.5 mm , antenna 5.6 mm , ovipositor sheath 7.7 mm ( Fig. 35 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 36 – 48
.
Nedinoschiza khuathalinhae Long
,
sp. nov.
, holotype, female. 36 Head, dorsal view 37 Head, frontal view 38 Head, lateral view 39 Mesonotum 40 Mesopleuron 41 Hind femur 42 Middle femur 43 Fore tibia 44 Fore wing 45 Hind wing 46 Middle and hind tarsal claws 47 Metasoma 48 Hypopygium, lateral.

FIGURES 49 . Habitus of
Nedinoschiza khuathalinhae Long
,
sp. nov.
, paratype, male (lateral).

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation . Females: length of body 5.3–9.0 mm; fore wing 4.6–8.4 mm ; antenna with 37–41 antennomeres.
Male . Length of body 4.1 mm , fore wing 4.1 mm , antenna 3.5 mm ; antenna with 30 antennomeres ( Fig. 49 ).
Distribution . NE Vietnam ( Tuyen Quang ); NC Vietnam ( Ha Tinh ).
Etymology . The new species is named after the granddaughter of the second author, Khuat Ha Linh.

Notes .
Nedinoschiza khuathalinhae
sp. nov.
is similar to
Nedinoschiza pinguis Papp
, from China in having the longitudinally striated midbasal area of second metasomal tergite and sculptured third metasomal tergite, but differs from
N. pinguis
by the following characters: 1) Length of eye 1.3 × as long as temple in dorsal view ( Fig. 36 ) [ vs 0.8 × in
N. pinguis
, cf. Fig. 4C in Ranjith & Priyadarsanan (2021) ]; 2) Midbasal area of second metasomal tergite 0.4 × second tergite length ( Fig. 47 ) [ vs 0.75 × in
N. pinguis
, cf. Fig. 5A in Ranjith & Priyadarsanan (2021) ]; and 3) Pronotum and mesoscutum black ( Fig. 39 ) [ vs yellow in
N. pinguis
, cf. Figs 4D, E in Ranjith & Priyadarsanan (2021) ].
